title: Plastic pollution at sea: the seventh continent
body: 1. Where does plastic pollution come from? Since its commercial development in the 1950s, plastic has been a real success. Its world production follows an exponential. It reached 288 million tonnes in 2012, an increase of 620% over 1975.
readable_content:
- The text appears to be a detailed analysis of plastic pollution in the world's oceans. It describes the sources of plastic pollution, its accumulation in gyres, the condition of plastic in the environment, and its effects on the ecosystem.
- The analysis presents alarming statistics, such as the estimated 80 to 120 tonnes of waste, including a large proportion of plastic, ending up at sea every minute.
- It also includes visual representations of plastic pollution and its impact on marine life, making the issue more tangible.
summary: The analysis of plastic pollution in the world's oceans is concerning and underscores the urgent need for action to address this pressing environmental issue. The statistics and visual representations highlight the severity of the situation and the detrimental impact on marine life. It's evident that addressing plastic pollution in the oceans is an important global challenge that requires immediate attention and collaborative efforts. Sentiment: 1.0
